alert.note: Alert for Dutchess; Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 7:03AM EST until February 28 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Hudson River Near Poughkeepsie. * WHEN...From this morning to late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 4.2 feet, Minor flood stage. Minor flooding of lowlands, boat docks and boat launches. Water covers State Route 213 in Eddyville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 4.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 AM EST Tuesday was 4.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 4.6 feet this morning. It will fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 4.2 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 4.5 feet on 12/21/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Hudson River Poughkeepsie Flood Stage: 4.2 Observed Stage at Tue 6 am: 4.4 Forecast: Tue 1 pm 1.4 Tue 7 pm 1.9 Wed 1 am -0.5 Wed 7 am 2.1 Wed 1 pm 0.1 Wed 7 pm 1.1 Thu 1 am -0.3 Thu 7 am 2.0 Thu 1 pm 0.5 Thu 7 pm 0.2 Fri 1 am -0.6 &&
